item.title: Open Circuits
item.description: A photographic exploration of the surprisingly beautiful design inside everyday electronics that unlocks a world of hidden wonder.
item.author: (by Windell Oskay and Eric Schlaepfer)

item.title: Microsoft Previews Azure Deployment Environments
item.description: During the recent Ignite Conference, Microsoft announced the public preview of Azure Deployment Environments. This managed service enables dev teams to quickly spin up app infrastructure with project-based templates to establish consistency and best practices while maximizing security, compliance, and cost-efficiency.
item.author:
(Steef-Jan Wiggers
Cloud Queue Lead EditorFollow)

item.title: Open Source Skyplane Targets Faster and Cheaper Data Transfers between Clouds
item.description: A team of researchers at the RISELab at UC Berkeley has recently released Skyplane, an open source tool to optimize the transfer of large datasets between cloud providers, reducing transfer times and costs.
item.author: (Renato Losio)

item.title: Microsoft Introduces Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: During the recent Ignite conference, Microsoft announced Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL, a new generally available (GA) service to build cloud-native relational applications. It is a distributed relational database offering with the scale, flexibility, and performance of Azure Cosmos DB.
item.author:
(Steef-Jan Wiggers
Cloud Queue Lead EditorFollow)

item.title: A Real World React -> htmx Port
item.description: It is all well and good talking about REST & HATEOAS in theory or describing the Hypermedia-Driven Application architecture, but, at the end of the day, what matters in software is practical: Does it work? Does it improve things?
